result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frederic Michael Buettner Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Frederic Michael Buettner Jr in court.  Attorney William Andrew Mayer in court for Frederic Michael Buettner Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel j Gabler Mr. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Frederic Michael Buettner Jr. in court by Attorney William Andrew Mayer. Victim present.   Atty. Mayer request additional date.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Motion for Discovery and Inspection & Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Frederic Michael Buettner Jr. in court and by Attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Victim present in court.  State requests $1,500 cash bond.  Argument on bond.  $5,000 signature bond continued.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Received on 7-14-22 (sent copy to defendant, Atty Mayer and District Atty)
Hearing on August 17, 2022 at 08:15 am. Notice prepared 7-14-22

Prosecuting Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Edgar Beltran via video as a friend of the Court.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  State requests 30 days to file criminal complaint.  Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender.  Court finds probable cause based on reports provided by the State.  State has no objection to a signature bond.  $5,000 signature bond set.  Court appoints Atty. William Mayer.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $50 per month commencing 9-01-2022.  Adjourned for State to finalize charges and to allow defendant to appear with Atty. Mayer.  Reports returned to the State.
Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.
